content: this is dmg and we're making goo sludge slime pools and all kinds of other stuff
where are the slime pool sludge and goo whole thing sticky how about you so now
we're going to use our clear plastic bases as we did in the fire video I was
going to grab two pieces and create slightly larger than mini based size
circles just using a red texture so that you can see how big it is it's a little
bit more difficult to see these on low resolution you may not be able to see
them at all but too large the mini base size circle then what I'm gonna do is
place hot glue in the center in a nice circle and basically spiral it inwards
and lying the glue to flow towards the middle and to try and stop the wisps
from happening again to pull it away very slowly vertically and spin it
around so the heat at the top of the glue gun stops the wisps and do that on
the second one as well circle around and spiral it inwards and
this is essentially the whole process other than painting and you can create
any size pools and goo it's completely up to you and now getting it to dry is
one thing but you can do this just grab glass of water and dunk it in
there and it hardens pretty much instantaneously somewhat on the dm's
craft forums came up with that very cool there you go just dunk it in there and
hardens almost instantly so you just shake off the water and now I'm just
gonna apply green paint to one of them just all over the edges and right over
the cove but not underneath the curve and just apply the paint and make sure
that the paint is thick so you can't see through it and then I'll start to apply
black onto the other one so this could be you know a
black pudding or oil slick now to those I'm going to add some white paint I'm
just going to swirl it around in the wet paint to create a sort of a swirl
mixture there just to give it some some interest and somewhat a reflective sort
of look to it and the same with the black one as well now you can apply the
high-gloss water-based varnish to this but I just leave them as they are very
easy there they are on the tile must close up and very simple the clear bases
help you to put it on pretty much any surface that you like so that's how you
can make pools and slime and goo and all kinds of other sticky and nasty
substances monsters etc like a black pudding food anyway if you'd like to
find out any more check out the Facebook page the Google+ page the website the
dmg dot info and of course there's an email newsletter as well see you next
time
